channel.title: ios on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in ios on Barefoot Rob

item.title: iOS app versioning
item.description: 07:18 Friday 15 September 2017 JST Ugh. I previously uploaded version 2.2.1 of an iOS app. This time I uploaded 2.2.3 and the reply was “Oh you already uploaded version 2.2.3” Fine ffs so I boosted the version to 2.2.4 and uploaded it. Now they say the version number must be higher than 2.21. I never uploaded 2.21!!111 I uploaded 2.2.1. WTF kinda checks are they doing? This is sofa king annoying.

item.title: New Terms and Conditions
item.description: 17:09 Monday 28 August 2017 JST I called Apple Worldwide Support to ask why their docs say I need LaunchImages with sizes X, Y, Z, while an error message says I need a LaunchImage of size A. Their answer: accept the new Terms and Conditions and try my upload again. What?

item.title: met Tariq in Tokyo
item.description: 20:46 Thursday 27 July 2017 JST Just met Tariq for a few minutes in Tokyo station to create leaderboards in GameCenter for our iOS apps with scores.

item.title: worked on Apple Memory
item.description: 17:51 Thursday 27 July 2017 JST After lunch with Esther I worked on Apple Memory for 90 minutes. Got three instances of deprecated code replaced with ((what I assume is) soon-to-be deprecated) code.

item.title: Oh iOS why dost thou vex me so
item.description: 08:50 Monday 17 July 2017 JST I guess it’s because I no longer wish to understand your mysterious ways.

item.title: app dev
item.description: 17:28 Monday 28 November 2016 JST After teaching I met with Tariq and showed him the latest changes on the iOS app we’re working on. Now balls are fired from a fixed point and are angled according to tap location.

item.title: apps
item.description: 09:36 Tuesday 25 October 2016 JST Meeting with Tariq now in Shiodome to discuss iOS apps. 11:57 Tuesday 25 October 2016 JST Good productivity on iOS app; working with a couple of example games from Ray Wenderlich including a breakout game (yay), I think we can get it finished sooner than later. I hope!

item.title: IAP tangled up
item.description: ##12:28 Tuesday 02 December 2014 JST## I’m trying to test the In-App Purchases for our new app, but for some reason all the descriptions are off. When I click this one it buys that one and when I buy that one it buys the other one. I thought I had all this shit worked out. ##13:02 Got it worked out. Apparently Apple returns the list of products in alphabetical order instead of by the order I list them in my code.

item.title: So we are thinking about PhoneGap
item.description: ##02:36 Saturday 01 November 2014 JST## So we are thinking about Phonegap. I’m trying to install Android SDK now. ![]()

item.title: Trouble to get iOS app validated
item.description: ##02:32 Saturday 01 November 2014 JST## Went to Tariq’s tonight to try getting progress on uploading an app using Testflight just so we can test it during development. And today, I couldn’t even get that far. ##12:50 Monday 03 November 2014 JST Wow! I got a call from Apple today. Harumi explained that I need to create the app in itunesconnect in order to deploy it over TestFlight. This is different than before Apple bought TestFlight.
